subject: Data
title: The Privacy Paradox of Open Data
description: A quick win: understand The Privacy Paradox of Open Data.

hook.text: New York City published taxi ride data. Researchers re-identified celebrity passengers within hours.

buildup.text: Open data can accidentally reveal personal information even when names are removed.

discovery.text: With enough data points â€” location, time, demographics â€” anonymized records become identifiable individuals.

twist.text: Researchers showed that 4 random data points could uniquely identify 95% of people in a mobile phone dataset.

climax.text: The tension between openness and privacy is the central ethical challenge of the open data movement.

punchline.text: Open data and privacy are partners in tension, not enemies.

quiz.question: How many data points can uniquely identify most people in a dataset?
